valuesToReadableStrings.live: (env=live or cluster=ve or cluster=sv2 or cluster=lv7)

charts.description:
1 = UP,  0  = DOWN.
If process metrics stop flowing, either kube-box-pki is down or there is an issue with metrics forwarding to wavefront.
charts.name: UP/DOWN
Data Points Ingested: Wavefront vs Castle

sources.name: Total Agent Dropped Points
sources.query: msum(10m, ${Total Agent Points Received}-${Total Agent Points Sent})

description: One look summary about the load balancer
name: Skynet Octoproxy Dev

charts.description: Memory usage of the entire Octoproxy container
charts.name: Memory Usage

description: One look summary about the load balancer
name: Skynet Octoproxy

sources.name: Source
sources.query: ts(proc.net.percent, (host=compute-node2001 or host=compute-node2001 or host=compute-node1001 or host=compute-node1002 or host=compute-node3001 or host=compute-node3002) and iface=vlan*)

charts.description: Memory usage of the entire Octoproxy container
charts.name: Memory Usage
Ready Calico Pods on Ready Calico Uncrdnd Nodes

sources.name: ReadyCalicoPodCountRaw
sources.query: align(1m, max, default(0,ts(kube.metrics.pod_status_ready, condition=true and (namespace="calico-dev" or namespace="calico-prod")  )))
sources.sourceDescription: The align and  default is to avoid unintentional interpolation

sources.name: ReadyCalicoPodCount
sources.sourceDescription: Reduce the number of tags in this time series

sources.name: PodInfoRaw
sources.query: align(1m, max, default(0, ts(kube.metrics.pod_info, (namespace="calico-dev" or namespace="calico-prod") )))
sources.sourceDescription: The align and  default is to avoid unintentional interpolation

sources.name: PodInfo
sources.sourceDescription: Move the pod info to the metrics field

sources.name: RdyCalicUncrdndNdsWithPod
sources.sourceDescription: Append the calico pod name information to the ready uncordoned calico node points.

sources.name: RdyCalicUncrdndNdsRenamed
sources.sourceDescription: Swap the node field and the pod field. Previously node was a tag and pod was in the metrics. After this transformation, node is in the metrics and pod is a tag.

sources.name: Ready Calico Pods from Ready Calico Uncrdnd Nodes
Alert Condition
sources.query: rawsum(${RdyCalicUncrdndNdsRenamed},dc) != ${Ready Calico Pods from Ready Calico Uncrdnd Nodes}
sources.sourceDescription: Used in the alert Calico - Ready Pods in Calico Pool - LOW  https://box.wavefront.com/alerts/1497909225742/edit

charts.name: Not Ready Calico Pods on Ready Calico Uncrdnd Node

sources.name: NotReadyCalicoPodsRaw
sources.query: align(1m, max, default(0, ts(kube.metrics.pod_status_ready, condition=false and (namespace="calico-dev" or namespace="calico-prod") )))
sources.sourceDescription: Get the nodes that are not ready in calico namespace. The align and default are for purposes of avoiding interpolation.  This waveform is missing the node information. In the following queries we use pod_info metric to add node information to this waveform.

sources.name: NotReadyCalicoPods
sources.sourceDescription: Only keep the pod and DC tags

sources.name: PodInfoRaw
sources.query: align(1m, max, default(0, ts(kube.metrics.pod_info,   (namespace="calico-dev" or namespace="calico-prod")     )))
sources.sourceDescription: The align and default are for purposes of avoiding interpolation.

sources.name: NotReadyCalicoPodsWithNodeInMetrics
sources.sourceDescription: append the node information to the not-ready calico pods waveform.

sources.name: NotReadyCalicoPodsWithNode
sources.sourceDescription: Add the node tag back from metrics so that the table contains a node column.

sources.name: RdyCalicUncrdndNdsWithNode
sources.sourceDescription: Keep the first part of the node tag. Drop the dc.box.net portion. This way the node names will match the tag values in NotReadyCalicoPodsWithNode

sources.name: AlertCondition
sources.sourceDescription: Used in this alert     Calico - Unready Pods - HIGH      https://box.wavefront.com/alerts/1497912183745/edit

sections.name: Bird State Per Node in Selected Cluster

charts.name: Bird Intfs to Both TOR's UP/DOWN

sources.name: BirdUpWithNode
sources.sourceDescription: Create a node tag from the source. This way we can do series matching with the RdyCalicUncrdndNds series

charts.name: Bird BGP Session to Both TOR's Established YES/NO

sources.name: BgpStateWithNode
sources.sourceDescription: Create a node tag from the source. This way we can do series matching with the RdyCalicUncrdndNds series.

sources.name: Alert Condition
sources.sourceDescription: Used in the alert Calico - Bird BGP State - NOT ESTABLISHED https://box.wavefront.com/alerts/1499970904394/edit

description: Monitors for Metadata in the PHP webapp
name: Metadata PHP

charts.name: API Success  Status Codes Per Minute

sources.name: Source
sources.query: ts("storm.content_api.response.count", env=${env} and event_type="*metadata*" and http_status_code="2*")

charts.name: API Error Status Codes Per Minute

sources.name: Source
sources.query: ts("storm.content_api.response.count", env=${env} and fq_rm="*metadata*" and (http_status_code="4*" or http_status_code="5*"))

sources.name: Source
sources.query: ts("storm.content_api.response.count", env=${env} and fq_rm="*metadata*" and http_status_code="5*")

description: Metrics about each operation that can be performed against the data store
name: Metadata Operations

description: Monitors for testing Metadata in the PerfPods
name: Metadata PerfPod

valuesToReadableStrings.Label: if(${older_than_five}, align(${downsample}, sum, sum(default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.created, env=${env} and (${jobTypes}))), jobType)))
align(${downsample}, sum, sum(default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.error, env=${env} and (${jobTypes}))), jobType))
align(${downsample}, sum, sum(default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.retried, env=${env} and (${jobTypes}))), jobType))
align(${downsample}, sum, sum(default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.started, env=${env} and (${jobTypes}))), jobType))

(jobType=data_retention or jobType=event_fanout or jobType=run_disposition or jobType=enqueue_retention_notification or jobType=send_email_batch or jobType=disposition_scanner or jobType=disposition_tracker)
(jobType=event_fanout or jobType=disposition_tracker or jobType=disposition_scanner or jobType=run_disposition or jobType=enqueue_retention_notification or jobType=send_email_batch)

sources.name: Usage
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.created, env=${env} and (${jobTypesRetention})))))

sources.name: Source
sources.query: align(${downsample}, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.completed, env=${env} and (${jobTypesRetention}))))

sources.name: Usage
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(${downsample}, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.error, env=${env} and (${jobTypesRetention})))))

sources.name: Usage
sources.query: align(${downsample}, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.retried, env=${env} and (${jobTypesRetention}))))

sources.name: Usage
sources.query: align(${downsample}, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.retryExceeded, env=${env} and (${jobTypesRetention}))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.created, env=${env} and (${jobTypesDispPipeline})))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.created, env=${env} and (${jobTypesRunDisp})))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.created, env=${env} and (${jobTypesNotification})))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.completed, env=${env} and (${jobTypesDispPipeline})))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.completed, env=${env} and (${jobTypesRunDisp})))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.completed, env=${env} and (${jobTypesNotification})))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: if(${older_than_five}, align(${downsample}, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.error, env=${env} and (${jobTypesDispAll})))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: align(${downsample}, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.retried, env=${env} and (${jobTypesDispAll}))))

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: align(${downsample}, sum, default(0, ts(storm.job-manager.jobs.retryExceeded, env=${env} and (${jobTypesDispAll}))))

sources.name: Source
sources.query: align(1m, sum, default(0, ts(storm.http_response_code, fq_rm=box_content_workflow_worker_send_email_batch and env=${env})))
